alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 01 at 3:09PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Guam. * WHEN...Through late Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Although heavy rain is not an currently imminent, a period of moderate intensity rainfall is possible after midnight tonight. Soil conditions are already saturated, which will allow for runoff to easily commence. The best potential for heavy rainfall will be in the late Saturday night through Monday morning time frame when flash flooding potential would be higher, but again given the soil conditions, any period of moderate rainfall lasting an hour or two would likely lead to some flooding concerns beforehand. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
